H0.text: what countries speak english natively. United States

H1.text: what countries speak english natively. United Kingdom

H2.text: what countries speak english natively. Australia

H3.text: what countries speak english natively. Canada

A4.text: The United States and India have the most total English speakers, with 306 million and 129 million, respectively.

A5.text: Five of the largest of these are sometimes described as the 'core Anglosphere'; they are the United Kingdom, the United States, Australia, Canada, and New Zealand.

A6.text: 32 out of the 50 states of the United States have designated English as their official language.

A7.text: The United Kingdom, Australia, New Zealand, Antigua and Barbuda, and the United States do not have English as a de jure official language, but it is the de facto working language for their governments.
